meanings.definition: In a manner that seeks to gain favor by flattering or praising excessively.
meanings.sent1: She sycophantically complimented her boss to get a promotion.
meanings.sent2: He spoke sycophantically to the teacher to get a better grade.
meanings.sent3: The student sycophantically praised the cafeteria food to avoid doing homework.
meanings.sent4: The politician sycophantically praised his opponent to win over voters.
meanings.sent5: The employee sycophantically flattered the manager to get a day off.

meanings.definition: Behaving in a servile or obsequious manner in order to gain advantage or favor.
meanings.sent1: The sycophantically student always agreed with the teacher.
meanings.sent2: She received the promotion by acting sycophantically towards her boss.
meanings.sent3: The sycophantically waiter constantly hovered around the VIP table.
meanings.sent4: The sycophantically behavior of the assistant annoyed her colleagues.
meanings.sent5: His sycophantically attitude towards the celebrity was transparent to everyone.
